_comment: Created by hdorning on 23/08/2017 15:38:42 using v2.7
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary:
The number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over time from quarter to quarter, but there is generally a peak in Q4 of each year. This is likely due to hospitals dealing with winter pressures.

However, there is an increasing trend in the number of cancelled elective operations. There were 6,753 more cancelled elective operation in Q4 2016/17 (21,219) than Q4 1994/95 (14,466) - a 47% increase.

Updated July 2017.
